About Me

Owais Hafiz Muhammad

I am a practical engineer by profession and a problem-solver at heart, driven by a passion for building impactful technologies. Over the years, I have accumulated valuable hands-on experience in cutting-edge domains such as Robotics, Autonomous Driving, and Unmanned Aerial Systems. My work has spanned the full ADAS stack—from intelligent perception systems (including both exterior and in-cabin sensing) to decision-making and real-time control systems, all deployed on high-performance computing platforms (HCPs).

My Career

Software Project Lead @ CARIAD SE (Volkswagen Group)

System Architect–Interior Cabin Monitoring System:

  • Leading end-to-end development of in-cabin camera software stack—including driver integration, image acquisition, control interfaces, and pre-processing pipelines optimized for neural network inference
  • Defined and owned software KPIs, system requirements, and modular architecture; provided technical leadership throughout design, development, and validation of camera-related components
  • Led cross-functional collaboration between perception, embedded, and platform teams to ensure seamless integration and real-time performance under automotive constraints
  • Architected and implemented scalable, hardware-agnostic middleware to enable efficient cross-platform deployment across various ADAS compute environments (ARM, x86, GPU, embedded SoCs)
System Lead – Multi-Function Camera System:
  • As a task force lead, spearheaded the analysis and resolution of stability and diagnostics issues in the Multi-Function Camera system, ensuring optimal performance and reliability
  • Collaborated with cross-functional teams to identify root causes and implement corrective actions, significantly improving system diagnostics and fault tolerance
  • Managed milestone delivery aligned with BMG/DET targets, successfully delivering results and releases tailored to each vehicle cluster
  • Co-created comprehensive documentation and training materials to support ongoing maintenance and future enhancements of the Multi-Function Camera system

Aug 2022 - Present
Senior System Lead ADAS/HAD Solutions

Project Lead @ Mobility Asia (CARIAD CN)

  • Program Management - Led ECU development programs, managing SW/HW development, deployment and validation cycles
  • Requirements Engineering - Defined system requirements for ADAS Domain Controllers
  • Hardware Development - Directed ECU hardware interfaces and design reviews
  • Software Development - Designed AUTOSAR CP/AP base software development together with team of 7 colleagues
  • Testing & Integration - Managed validation activities and supplier test campaigns

Jan 2021 - Jul 2022
Project Lead ADAP Computation Architecture

System Development Engineer @ VCIC (Audi/VW Group)

  • Defined system and ECU-level requirements for Top View and Advanced Parking features
  • Coordinated stakeholder inputs across system architecture teams
  • Led integration of new communication signals for ADAS Domain Controller

Jun 2020 - Dec 2020
System Development Engineer – ADAS L2++ Programs

Perception Algorithm Engineer @ HiRain Technologies

  • Developed TopView system with multi-camera setup and calibration
  • Built deep learning pipeline for semantic segmentation
  • Designed DNN for free space detection and indoor localization
  • Created traffic light distance estimation algorithm
  • Integrated multi-object tracking systems

Jul 2018 - May 2020
Perception Algorithm Engineer

Graduate Research Assistant @ Beijing Advanced Innovation Center

  • Developed online calibration for 9-DOF stereo vision system
  • Created CNN for UAV landing marker detection
  • Designed multi-modal sensor fusion system for autonomous vehicles

Sep 2016 - Jun 2018
Graduate Research Assistant

Research Engineer @ Virtual Reality & Driving Simulation Lab

  • Developed 6DOF SUV driving simulator with real-time rendering
  • Integrated VR system with motion platform for high-fidelity simulation

Oct 2015 - Jul 2016
Research Engineer

Adaptive Strategic Execution Program @ Duke University

Hybrid program focusing on strategic execution in technology leadership

Sep 2022 - Jul 2023

Awards & Honors

This section highlights my participation in various hackathons and competitions, showcasing innovative solutions and technical expertise. Each award represents a milestone in pushing boundaries, solving real-world challenges, and collaborating with brilliant minds.

Smart Mobility Challenge Winner

Honda · First Place

Winner of Honda Smart Mobility Hackathon, developing innovative solutions for future mobility challenges. Participated to push the boundaries of creativity and problem-solving in mobility, showcasing the cool intersection of technology and real-world impact.

First/Last Mile Innovation Challenge

Skoda · Winner

Won Skoda's Innovative First/Last Mile Challenge by developing unique solutions for urban mobility connectivity. Participated to explore cutting-edge ideas in urban mobility and to collaborate with like-minded innovators.

Automated Valet Parking Challenge

Bosch · Winner

First place in Bosch's Automated Valet Parking Challenge, developing advanced autonomous parking solutions. Participated to tackle real-world challenges in autonomous systems and to demonstrate technical expertise in a competitive environment.

Call For Code Challenge

Angelhack/IBM · Winner

Winner of Angelhack Call For Code Challenge, creating innovative solutions using IBM technologies. Participated to leverage cutting-edge tools and to contribute to impactful solutions addressing global challenges.

International Robotics Challenge

MBZIRC · First Place

Winner of the MBZIRC International Robotics Challenge, demonstrating excellence in autonomous robotics systems. Participated to push the limits of robotics innovation and to compete with the best minds in the field.

Best Technical Paper Award

Journal of Field Robotics · Winner

Awarded Best Technical Paper for groundbreaking research contribution in Advanced Autonomous Driving. Participated to share innovative research and to inspire advancements in the field of autonomous systems.

Startup Grind Recognition

Startup Grind · Recognition

Recognition at Startup Grind for innovative entrepreneurial achievements in automotive technology. Participated to showcase entrepreneurial spirit and to connect with a global community of innovators.
